intro: Eriospermum togoense, commonly known as the Togo eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
